text: Zakia Shahnawaz Khan (; born 5 March 1946) is a Pakistani politician who has been the member of the Provincial Assembly of the Punjab since May 2013. == Early life and education == Khan was born on 5 March 1946 in Isakhel. She received her education from St Denys High School, Murree and Queen Mary College, Lahore and completed matriculation level education. == Political career == Khan was elected to the Provincial Assembly of the Punjab on a reserved seat for women in Pakistani general election, 1977. She was re- elected to the Provincial Assembly of the Punjab on a reserved seat for women in Pakistani general election, 1985. She was elected to the Provincial Assembly of the Punjab as a candidate of Pakistan Muslim League (N) on a reserved seat for women in Pakistani general election, 2013. In June 2013, she was added in the provincial cabinet of Chief Minister Shahbaz Sharif and was made Provincial Minister of Punjab for Population Welfare. In November 2016, she was made Provincial Minister of Punjab for environment protection. == References == Category:1946 births Category:Living people Category:Politicians from Punjab, Pakistan
title: Zakia Shahnawaz Khan
